summary: This document is an email chain from July 2-3, 2020, regarding the custody arrangements for Ghislaine Maxwell at Merrimack County Department of Corrections. It discusses adding her New York attorneys to her approved contact list and outlines strict security protocols for her detention.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the custody arrangements and security protocols at Merrimack County DOC. She is a high-profile inmate whose communications are restricted to approved legal counsel.

persons.name: Lawrence Vogelman
persons.context: Attorney already on the approved list for Maxwell to communicate with, pending provision of a PIN.

persons.name: Chris Everdell
persons.context: One of Maxwell's New York attorneys whom the email sender requests be added to the approved contact list so he can speak with Maxwell.

persons.name: Mark Cohen
persons.context: One of Maxwell's New York attorneys whom the email sender requests be added to the approved contact list so he can speak with Maxwell.

connections.description: Vogelman is listed as authorized legal counsel for Maxwell, with communication permitted after he provides a PIN.
Everdell is identified as one of Maxwell's New York attorneys whom her representatives are seeking to add as approved contact.
Cohen is identified as one of Maxwell's New York attorneys whom her representatives are seeking to add as approved contact.

events.title: Custody Restrictions Issued for Maxwell
events.description: The Supervisory Deputy U.S. Marshal for the District of New Hampshire issues detailed custody and security restrictions for Ghislaine Maxwell at Merrimack County DOC.

events.title: Request to Add Attorneys to Contact List
events.description: An email is sent requesting that Maxwell's New York attorneys, Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen, be added to her approved phone contact list to facilitate case discussions.

locations: Merrimack County Department of Corrections (Merrimack DOC)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody at Merrimack County Department of Corrections under extremely high-security protocols, including 15-minute observation watches and restricted staff interaction.
Her communication was initially restricted to only one attorney, Lawrence Vogelman, requiring a PIN for contact.
Her legal team requested on July 3, 2020, that her New York attorneys, Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen, be added to the approved contact list to discuss case strategy.
The U.S. Marshals Service implemented strict procedures to prevent staff from speaking to the press about Maxwell or the security protocols.
The email chain indicates coordination between Maxwell's defense team and custodial authorities regarding her legal access while in detention.
